item.title: Home
item.content:encoded:
Hello, I’M A DESIGNER

"Infusing soul into digital brilliance. Welcome to my UX vibe, where every click carries rhythm and every design echoes the culture. Step into a world where innovation meets the heartbeat of black excellence."

item.title: About me
item.content:encoded:
WHO AM I?

Hello there! I'm Rhonelda Cupenala, an aspiring UX designer on a journey to create impactful and delightful user experiences. As a newcomer to the field, I bring fresh perspectives, a hunger for knowledge, and a passion for crafting digital interactions that leave a lasting impression.

item.title: Portfolio
item.content:encoded:
OUR PARTNERS

Dream it

•

Build it

•

Grow it

•

Dream it • Build it • Grow it •

Somatic Design Projects (SDP1 & SDP2):

Our team embarked on the creation of the Sensation Fan Premium, a multi-sensory fan aimed at enhancing user experiences through somatic sensations. We integrated electronic components to enable interactivity and connectivity, aligning the product with the Internet of Things.

Description of Design Problems and Role:

Our design challenge was to enhance user experience and functionality while integrating electronic components into the fan. My role involved conceptualizing, prototyping, and refining the product, addressing challenges such as circuit malfunctions and compatibility issues.

Review of Design Process:

We began with low-fidelity prototypes, iteratively refining our design based on group feedback and research. Challenges included integrating Bluetooth connectivity and troubleshooting component malfunctions. Despite setbacks, we progressed to high-fidelity prototyping, refining aesthetics and functionality.

Evaluation of Final Design:

The Sensation Fan Premium offers a unique, multi-sensory experience, integrating motion detection, haptic feedback, audio, and visual elements. While challenges arose during the design process, such as Bluetooth compatibility issues and circuit malfunctions, our iterative approach enabled us to overcome obstacles and deliver a compelling final product.

Answers to Key Questions:

We accomplished the creation of a multi-sensory fan, enhancing user experiences through somatic sensations. Challenges included Bluetooth compatibility issues and circuit malfunctions. We responded to challenges by conducting thorough research, seeking alternative solutions, and iterating on designs. Aspects of the design process that worked included iterative prototyping and collaboration within the team. Challenges with Bluetooth compatibility and circuit malfunctions highlighted areas for improvement. We learned the importance of thorough research, adaptability, and collaboration in the design process. The design process contributed to my evolution as a UX designer by reinforcing the importance of user-centric design, problem-solving, and iterative refinement.
